Whilst working with the group to retrieve a biological weapon, she became the one-sided crush of former patient"John Doe"and an associate ofBruce Wayne. Quinn would later betray the Pact and become one of the factors for John's transformation into the Joker.

name: Ratcatcher
description: While the small furry army at his control is, at first glance, a rather odd and seemingly useless gift, The Ratcatcher has used his minions to plague Gotham on more than one occasion. Imagine, if you will, a single rat. Small, weak, but strangely intelligent (just like Flannegan, who possesses an odd similarity in look to the small creatures.) But, imagine multiplying this single biting rodent by tens of thousands; a seemingly unstoppable sea of rats able to attack on a near biblical scale, all ...

name: Razor
description: He was an inmate of Blackgate Prison, and was shipped to Arkham after a mysterious fire at Blackgate. Razor is first seen when the prisoners lockAaron Cashand a doctor in a Joker-gas infected room. One of them mentions that Razor is still in there. Joker remarks, "He was too slow." When Batman goes up through the ventilation system and enters the room flooded with gas, he sees an inmate, presumably Razor, struggling on a line. Batman is forced to cut Razor down to get to the control panel. Razor...

name: Rex_Calabrese
description: Rex "The Lion" Calabreseis a lion themedGotham Citymobster created for the New 52. Calabrese was retconned into being the biological crime-lord father ofCatwoman, a position most traditionally and more popularly held byCarmine "The Roman" Falcone.

name: Rhino_and_Mugsy
description: The Ventriloquist is most accompanied by Rhino who serves as a loyal bodyguard. Rhino is sometimes portrayed as genuinely believing Scarface to be the boss, but more often is shown as humoring Wesker (and sometimes forgetting and addressing the Ventriloquist directly, to Scarface's outrage). Rhino, as his name implies, is a massive, musclebound thug. His real name has been referred to as Frederick Rhino. Rhino also has a sister named Moose, who nearly as strong and loyal as he is. She takes his ...

name: The_Riddler
description: The Riddleris a criminal themed around riddles, puzzles and games, and frequent enemy ofBatman. Co-created byBill FingerandDick SprangforDetective Comics#140(October 1948),Edward "E." Nigma(sometimesNygmaandNashton), he themes his crimes around these, even leaving clues for Batman and thepoliceto solve hinting to his plans. Whilst not as physically capable as other enemies in the rogues gallery, Riddler is often considered one of Batman's most intelligent foes and has even manipulated others int...

name: Roland_Desmond
description: Roland Desmondis the secondBlockbuster, the first having been his brotherMark. He is a drug-enhanced behemoth, one of the reigning crime-lords ofBlüdhaven, and a major enemy ofNightwing.

name: Sewer_King_(DC_Comics)
description: The Sewer Kingis a villain originally created byTom Rueggeras a minor foe forBatman. He is a staff-carrying, sewer-dwelling villain with an army of runaway children he uses as pick-pockets.

name: Shark
description: SharkorSherman Shackleywas the alias ofGunther Hardwicke, member of theTerrible Trio. He wore the mask of a shark's head.

name: She-Bat
description: A few months later, the Langstroms traveled to Las Vegas, Nevada to study a rare breed of vampire bat that had surfaced following underground nuclear tests in New Mexico. While examining one of the bats, Francine pricked her finger on a fang and the toxin activated the dormant Man-Bat gene that still resided in her body. She transformed into a monster once again, but this time with more vampiric characteristics, including enhanced strength. In this iteration, Francine could only transform into a...

name: Sin_Tzu
description: Sin Tzuwas a master criminal obsessed with conquering seemingly unbeatable adversaries.

name: Spook
description: Val Kalibanis one of the world's greatest escape-artists, and uses his extraordinary abilities together with special effects to commit spectacular crimes and make people believe he was a real ghost. After several battles withBatman, he is defeated and beheaded byDamian Wayne.

name: Steeljacket
description: Steeljacketis an enemy ofBatmanwho is a human/bird hybrid.

name: Tally_Man
description: Tally-Manis a hit-man/mercenary inGotham Citywho themes himself around old-fashioned tax collectors and who was obsessed with murdering those who owed debts to others.

name: Tally_Man_II
description: TallymanII appears at the end ofDetective Comics#817as a new character apart of the "One Year Later" storyline. DuringBatman: Face the Face, he defeats several villains in thePenguin's employ (includingKGBeast,Magpie, the Ventriloquist, andOrca). Tally Man II even shows up at the Orca's household to finish off her husband, Terry Capshaw, who is being questioned by criminal-investigatorJason Bardat the time. Tallyman II then fires at Jason Bard's arm as he is reaching for his gun. While holding J...

name: Terrible_Trio
description: TheTerrible Triowas a team of three thieves who wore head covering masks that represented three different animals. They first appeared inDetective Comics#253(March, 1958).

name: The_Getaway_Genius
description: Roy Reynolds, a.k.a. "the Getaway Genius", is a criminal and getaway mastermind who encounters theBatmanseveral times. He first appeared inBatman#170 (March, 1965): "Genius of the Getaway Gimmicks!"

name: Rupert_Thorne
description: Prominent head of one ofGotham City's top smuggling gangs,Rupert Thorneis also the boss ofMatches Malone, the criminal whose identity was taken over byBatman. Rupert is portrayed as a prolific crime-lord, corrupt city councilman, and leader of Gotham's exclusiveTobacconists' Club.

name: Trigger_Twins
description: A blonde, female criminal rescues them from a chain gang. She fools them into believing she is their long lost sister; this is a ruse to ensure their help in her plans.Robinand many other heroes, including Pow Wow Smith and Nighthawk help take them down. Much of the action takes place in a recreation of a classic wild west town/Gotham City tourist attraction inRobin Annual #6(1997). Around this time, they are hired byRoland Desmond, operating out of the city ofBlüdhaven.

name: Tweedledee
description: Deever TweedAKATweedledeeis one half of the villain duoTweedledeeandTweedledum. They are ruthless gangsters and supervillains that appear as enemies ofBatman.

name: Tweedledum
description: Dumfree TweedAKATweedledumis one half of the villain duoTweedledeeand Tweedledum. The two are ruthless gangsters and supervillains that appear as enemies of Batman.

name: Two-Face_(Telltale)
description: Harvey Dentis a former District Attorney and friend ofBruce Waynewho ran for Mayor ofGothamagainstHamilton Hill. However, after being injected with a psychoactive chemical by theChildren of Arkham(and possibly disfigured), he lost control of his sanity and developed a second personality. Now dubbedTwo-Faceby the media, he became obsessed with fate, chance and cruel justice.

name: Raya_Vestri
description: Raya is an old friend ofDick Graysonfrom his childhood atHaly's Circus. The two seemed to share a mutual crush, but parted ways after the murder of Dick's parents and adoption byBruce Wayne. After the circus returns toGotham City, Raya is reunited with her childhood friend.

name: Victor_Zsasz
description: Victor Zsasz(referred to asZsaszorMr. Zsasz) is a prolific serial killer and an enemy ofBatman. Zsasz is a difficult killer to track as he has no modus operandi outside of posing his victims' corpses in lifelike poses, and carving a tally-mark into his flesh for each kill. Zsasz is motivated by believing all life to be meaningless cycles of pain and that he is actually saving his victims from having to live on.

name: Vulture
description: VultureorVolperwas the alias of Armand Lydecker, member of theTerrible Trio. He wore the mask of a vulture's head.

name: White_Rabbit
description: Jaina HudsonAKAWhite Rabbitis anAlice in Wonderlandthemed enemy ofBatmanwho is an Indian socialite with the super-power to duplicate herself as an albino criminal who has enhanced speed and dresses like aplayboy-bunny.

name: Maxie_Zeus
description: A deranged gang leader,Maximilian "Maxie" Zeuscame to believe himself an avatar of the Olympian god Zeus. Creating a cult-like gang of henchmen to do his bidding, Zeus became a power-player in the Gotham City underworld. His criminal activities are perpetrated by his army of followers, and—he believes—overseen by the ancient Greek gods themselves.

name: Tony_Zucco
description: Anthony "Tony" Zuccois a fictional character in the DC Comics universe. He was introduced in Detective Comics #38 (April 1940) and is most well known for his connections to the origin ofRobin, namely in killingDick Grayson's parents theFlying Graysons.

name: Batman
description: Batmanis a crimefighter operating inGotham City, he serves as its protector, using the symbol of abatto strike fear into the hearts of criminals. Unlike other superheroes, Batman is often depicted to lack any "superpowers", instead using lifelong training and equipment to fight crime. His secret identity isBruce Wayne, a rich playboy and philanthropist who swore to fight crime after witnessing his parents' brutal murder. He has served as a member of various teams, including theJustice League, th...

name: Nightwing
description: Nightwingis aBatman-inspired superhero/vigilante alias in the DC universe which is most-notably used byDick Grayson, the patron-vigilante ofBlüdhavenand the originalRobin. The nameNightwingis inspired bySuperman'sstories.

name: Robin_(Dick_Grayson)
description: The youngest in a family of acrobats known as the "Flying Graysons," Dick watched as a mafia boss killed his parents in order to extort money from the circus that employed them (whose name was later revealed to beTony Zucco). Bruce Wayne, secretly the vigilante Batman, took him in as his legal ward after witnessing their deaths, and eventually as his sidekick,Robin.

name: Robin_(Tim_Drake)
description: Timothy "Tim" Jackson Drakeis a crimefighter that works withBatman. As the thirdRobinin theBatmancomics, he served asBatman's sidekick, and he is a superhero in his own right. He currently uses the superhero identity ofRed Robin.

name: Robin_(Damian_Wayne)
description: Damian Wayneis the only biological son ofBruce WayneandTalia, the only grandson ofRa's al Ghul. The character was created by Mike W. Barr, and first appeared inBatman: Son of the Demon(1987).

name: Red_Hood
description: The Red Hoodis an alias assumed by several criminals in the Batman Mythos. While rarely having a consistent modus operandi between incarnations, the figure is often leader (or figurehead) of theRed Hood Gang.

name: Red_Robin
description: Timothy "Tim" Jackson Drakeis a crimefighter that works withBatman. As the thirdRobinin theBatmancomics, he served asBatman's sidekick, and he is a superhero in his own right. He currently uses the superhero identity ofRed Robin.

name: Batgirl_(Cassandra_Cain)
description: Cassandra Cainis a member of theBat-Familyas a protégé and adoptive daughter of Batman. The daughter of assassinsDavid CainandLady Shiva, she was raised to become the greatest weapon for theLeague of Assassins. However, horrified from her first killing, she fled to the Batman family for protection. Becoming the fourth claimant of theBatgirlidentity, she helped him andTim Drakeprotect Gotham. Cassandra has also used other identities, includingBlack BatandOrphan.

name: Batgirl_(Stephanie_Brown)
description: Stephanie was born the daughter of theCluemaster, one ofGotham City's third-rate villains. Stephanie's father spent most of her childhood in prison or away from the family, and though he claimed to be "rehabilitated upon his return to Gotham", Stephanie was furious to discover that he was actually returning to crime without his need to leave clues behind. She decided something needed to be done. Stephanie tailored a costume for herself, and called herself the Spoiler. She knew where her father w...

name: Batwoman
description: Batwomanis the name of several superheroines, usually mysterious, but love-interests of Batman. The mainstream version is Kate Kane and the Pre-Crisis version is Kathy Kane, on Earth 11, she is the reverse-gender counterpart ofBatmanhimself, inJLA: The Nail,Selina Kyle, takes the name afterBatgirlandRobinwere killed by theJoker. Different versions of the character appear in other media, however, Kate Kane, as Batwoman, appears inDC Universe Online.

name: Kate_Kane
description: Katherine "Kate" Kaneis the secondBatwoman. Debuting in52#11, she is a member of the Kane family and, throughher father, the cousin ofBruce Wayne. Batwoman has headlinedher own comic seriessince 2011 and served as a vital member of theBat-Family.

name: Alfred_Pennyworth
description: Alfred was originally nearly a completely different Butler character calledAlfred Beagle, a retired intelligence agent who followed the deathbed wish of his dying father,Jarvis Beagle, to carry on the tradition of serving the Wayne Family. To that end, Alfred introduced himself toBruce WayneandDick GraysonatWayne Manorand insisted on becoming their butler. Although the pair did not want one, especially since they did not want to jeopardize their secret identities with a servant in the house, the...

name: Huntress
description: Huntressis a mask-vigilante and superheroine. She was originally introduced asHelena Wayne, the daughter of theBatmanandCatwomanonEarth-Two. Following DC'sCrisis on Infinite Earths, the character was reestablished as Helena Bertinelli, the daughter of a mob boss turned vigilante onNew-EarthandPrime-Earth. Both characters have been adapted into other universes and forms of media.

name: Oracle
description: This is a disambiguation page — a list of articles associated with the same title.

name: Spoiler
description: Stephanie was born the daughter of theCluemaster, one ofGotham City's third-rate villains. Stephanie's father spent most of her childhood in prison or away from the family, and though he claimed to be "rehabilitated upon his return to Gotham", Stephanie was furious to discover that he was actually returning to crime without his need to leave clues behind. She decided something needed to be done. Stephanie tailored a costume for herself, and called herself the Spoiler. She knew where her father w...

name: Two-Face
description: Two-Faceis a criminal split between "good" and "evil" sides. OnceGotham City's amiable and courteous District Attorney,Harvey Dentwas one ofBatman's closest allies and friends, working with the vigilante to clean up the city. However, after being horribly disfigured during a trial, Dent's sanity fractured and he became one of the city's most notorious criminals, obsessed with duality, fate, chance and (occasionally) the number two. Unlike other villains, Two-Face often is displayed as having a m...

name: Penguin
description: The Penguin(Oswald Chesterfield Cobblepot) is aGotham Citysupervillain and an enemy ofBatman. Co-created by artistBob Kaneand writerBill Finger, he first appeared inDetective Comics#58(December 1941). One of Batman's oldest foes, the Penguin is often presented as a gentleman of crime, often developing elaborate schemes whilst presenting himself as innocent of many of his activities. An eccentric criminal mastermind, he is well-known for his love of ornithology and use oftechnology-fitted umbrell...

name: Oswald_Cobblepot
description: The Penguin(Oswald Chesterfield Cobblepot) is aGotham Citysupervillain and an enemy ofBatman. Co-created by artistBob Kaneand writerBill Finger, he first appeared inDetective Comics#58(December 1941). One of Batman's oldest foes, the Penguin is often presented as a gentleman of crime, often developing elaborate schemes whilst presenting himself as innocent of many of his activities. An eccentric criminal mastermind, he is well-known for his love of ornithology and use oftechnology-fitted umbrell...

name: Riddler
description: The Riddleris a criminal themed around riddles, puzzles and games, and frequent enemy ofBatman. Co-created byBill FingerandDick SprangforDetective Comics#140(October 1948),Edward "E." Nigma(sometimesNygmaandNashton), he themes his crimes around these, even leaving clues for Batman and thepoliceto solve hinting to his plans. Whilst not as physically capable as other enemies in the rogues gallery, Riddler is often considered one of Batman's most intelligent foes and has even manipulated others int...

name: Edward_Nygma
description: The Riddleris a criminal themed around riddles, puzzles and games, and frequent enemy ofBatman. Co-created byBill FingerandDick SprangforDetective Comics#140(October 1948),Edward "E." Nigma(sometimesNygmaandNashton), he themes his crimes around these, even leaving clues for Batman and thepoliceto solve hinting to his plans. Whilst not as physically capable as other enemies in the rogues gallery, Riddler is often considered one of Batman's most intelligent foes and has even manipulated others int...

name: Selina_Kyle
description: Catwomanis a cat-themed criminal fromGotham Cityand one ofBatman's most-well known enemies.Selina Kyleis often portrayed as a thief and cat burglar with divided loyalties. Her criminal activities are often tempered by a reluctant altruism, making her an inconstant villain and occasional ally to Batman. She regularly eludes capture by the Dark Knight and maintains a complicated relationship which frequently fluctuates between flirtatious to romantic. From 2002'sHushstoryline, Catwoman has often b...

name: Scarecrow
description: Dr. Jonathan Crane, also known as theScarecrow, is aGotham Citysupervillain and a major enemy ofBatman. Created by Batman creatorsBill FingerandBob Kane, he first appeared inWorld's Finest Comics #3(Fall 1941). His scarecrow costume, lanky appearance and surname were inspired by Ichabod Crane of the horror fable "The Legend of Sleepy Hollow".

name: Jonathan_Crane
description: Dr. Jonathan Crane, also known as theScarecrow, is aGotham Citysupervillain and a major enemy ofBatman. Created by Batman creatorsBill FingerandBob Kane, he first appeared inWorld's Finest Comics #3(Fall 1941). His scarecrow costume, lanky appearance and surname were inspired by Ichabod Crane of the horror fable "The Legend of Sleepy Hollow".

name: Ra's_al_Ghul
description: Raʾs al Ġhūlis a supervillain and enemy ofBatman. A former healer who later chose a moniker that translates to "Head of the Demon", he is a criminal mastermind and leader of theLeague of Assassins. In most stories, Ra's' goal is to save the Earth from possible ecological devastation, often by destroying most of the planet's population or bringing the world under his control. Though brilliant master of strategy with knowledge in various fields, Ra's al Ghul's greatest asset are hisLazarus Pits, w...

name: Talia_al_Ghul
description: Taliais an occasional lover and enemy ofBatman, the most cherished child ofRa's al Ghul, known as theDaughter of the Demon. As a high-ranking member of theLeague of Assassins, she is sometimes referred to by titles likeTalia HeadorTalia al Ghul, signifying her status as Daughter of the Demon. For a time she was a key member ofLexCorp. Talia was briefly married to Batman and is also the mother ofDamian Wayne, Batman's biological son and the fifthRobin.

name: League_of_Assassins
description: The League of Assassins was founded byRa's al Ghul(exactly when is unknown) to be the "Fang that protects the Head."[1]Members of the League demonstrated a willingness to die at a word from Ra's. They have included some of the most dangerous assassins in the world includingLady Shiva,David Cain, and master archerMerlyn. For much of its current history, any member to fail in an assassination was in turn targeted by the League (and indeed, one of its best-known members, the master-archer Merlyn wa...

name: Victor_Fries
description: Dr. Victor Fries(Pronounced "freeze") was an accomplished cryogenicist whose beloved wifeNorawas stricken with a fatal degenerative disease. Fries placed her in suspended animation while searching for a way to cure her. ButGothCorp's CEOFerris Boylestopped funding the research—and Nora's life—and pulled the plug, triggering an accident that transformed Fries' body into a cold-blooded form that must always be kept at sub-zero temperatures; at normal room temperature he will die.

name: Pamela_Isley
description: Poison Ivyis the alter ego taken byDr. Pamela Lillian Isley, an eco-terrorist and prominent enemy ofBatman. First appearing inBatman#181, she is depicted as one of the world's most prominent eco-terrorists, motivated by an obsession with plants, misandry, botany, and extremist environmentalism with a desire to save the world from the evils of man through any means necessary. A genius scientist and meta-human with hybridized plant DNA, Poison Ivy uses mutant plants, will-bending pheromones and to...

name: Waylon_Jones
description: Waylon Jones, also known asKiller Croc, is an alligator-wrestler and sideshow-freak turnedGotham Citymobster, sewer-dwelling super-criminal and enemy ofBatman. He is motivated due to having been born with a rare mutation that caused him to have reptile-like skin, leading to a lifetime of abuse and prejudice which drove him to madness.

name: Kirk_Langstrom
description: Man-Bat(real nameDr. Robert Kirkland "Kirk" Langstrom) is an enemy toBatman, who first appeared inDetective Comics#400, illustrated byNeal Adams.

name: Floyd_Lawton
description: Floyd Lawton, better known asDeadshot, is mercenary, and known to be the world's greatest marksman and one the most lethal assassins in the world. Lawton has created an armored suit that aids him in his battles againstBatman. Deadshot has had a longstanding rivalry withDeathstroke.

name: Slade_Wilson
description: Deathstroke the Terminator, more often referred to as simplyDeathstroke, is a villain published by DC Comics. First appearing inNew Teen Titans#2,Slade Wilsonis a former soldier turned mercenary and assassin hired by those who can bid the highest. He is often considered an enemy of theTeen TitansandDick Grayson's arch-nemesis. However, Deathstroke has often encounteredBatmaneither due to contracts within Gotham and conflicts involving theJustice League. He is also the father ofGrant,JosephandRos...

name: Roman_Sionis
description: Roman Sionis, a former business executive and mafia boss who originally hatedBruce Waynerather than Batman, wears a black wooden mask and leads the Sionis Crime Family, also known as theFalse Facers. Black Mask eventually became a mob boss controlling large sections of Gotham City's criminal underworld. Following the suspicious death of his multi-millionaire parents, Sionis had inherited their fortune and went on to bankrupt their company. Saved by a buyout by Bruce Wayne, Sionis came to resent ...

name: Jervis_Tetch
description: Obsessed from a young age with Lewis Carroll'sAlice in Wonderland,Jervis Tetch, a brilliant neuroscientist, embraced a delusion that he was the incarnation of a character in the story, theMad Hatter. Using his hypnotic skills for mesmerism, Tetch as the Mad Hatter has committed many crimes, often themed around the book that inspired him and his love of hats and headgear, going so far as to plant his hats, ranging from pith helmets to bowlers, with mind control chips to amplify his hypnosis skill...

name: Julian_Day
description: Julian Gregory Day, better known asCalendar Man, is known for committing themed crimes that corresponded with holidays and significant dates. While sometimes used as a "Joke villain" Calendar Man was reintroduced inBatman: The Long Halloween, as an unsettling criminal-mastermind who keeps track of Gotham's ongoings from his cell inArkham Asylum. Gotham City's hopes for a day off are often clouded by the knowledge that any holiday of note is likely to be shadowed by Calendar Man's presence.

name: Garfield_Lynns
description: Fireflyis a pyromaniacal serial-arsonist and recurring enemy ofBatman. Originally a pyrotechnics expert,Garfield Lynnsturned to crime by carrying out arson attacks and torching huge parts of Gotham in the process. True to his name, Firefly was originally conceived as a light-based enemy of Batman and Robin. However, the modern incarnations are depicted as fire-based, often using gadgets and weapons with pyrotechnical means. Firefly is rarely seen withouta suit capable of protecting him from heat...

name: Ventriloquist
description: Arnold Weskeris a ventriloquist with multiple personalities. His puppet is a gangster namedScarface. Under the puppet's psychological influence, Wesker is a dangerous and ruthless criminal and crime boss. It has been implied that the Ventriloquist suffers from multiple personality disorder. Wesker was originally a timid orphan whose deep repression erupted into a barroom brawl, resulting in him being sent to Blackgate Prison. There, he encountered the ventriloquist dummy Scarface and promptly mu...

name: Anatoli_Knyazev
description: KGBeast(or in Rebirth continuity, simplyThe Beast) is a Russian super-villain, an assassin, and also an enemy ofBatman.

name: Professor_Pyg
description: Lazlo ValentinorProfessor Pygis a deranged enemy ofBatman, broadly considered to be amongst his darkest and most disturbing. Pyg is a twisted surgeon, obsessed with the myth of Pygmalion and notions of physical perfection. Due to this, he kidnapsGothamcitizens to horrifically transform into his obedient, "Dollotrons". Professor Pyg is also the leader of theCircus of Strange, a syndicate of circus-freak themed meta-human criminals.

name: Thomas_Elliot
description: Dr. Thomas "Tommy" Elliotwas a childhood friend ofBruce Wayne. He becomes a costumed criminal who targets both Batman and Bruce Wayne. Although Hush's name originates from a nursery rhyme,Hushlives up to it by using manipulation and guile instead of noisy "signatures". Tommy and Bruce Wayne were childhood friends, and unbeknownst to Bruce, dark reflections of each other. A childhood sociopath, Elliot tried to kill his parents so he could inherit their fortune. When his plan failed, due partly to...

name: Commissioner_Gordon
description: James Worthington "Jim" Gordonis Commissioner of theGotham City Police Departmentand one ofBatman's most trusted allies. Created byBill FingerandBob Kane, he first appeared inDetective Comics#27 (May 1939) and served as one of Batman's first supporting character. In most incarnations, Gordon is the police commissioner ofGotham City. He shares the hero’s deep commitment of ridding the dark and corrupting city of crime.

name: Renee_Montoya
description: Renee Montoyais a character frequently featured in Batman and other DC publications. Created forBatman: The Animated Seriesbut debuting inBatman#475, she was originally a recurring member of theGotham City Police Departmentand ally to theBatman Family. Montoya became one of the main focus characters in theGotham Centralcomic series, serving as one of theMajor Crimes Unitofficers. After quitting the GCPD at the series' conclusion, she featured heavily in the52event series, during which she was se...

name: Clark_Kent
description: Supermanis a superhero, and ally ofBatman. Unlike Batman, Superman has a vast amount of superpowers at his disposal naturally occurring in the presence of a yellow star.

name: Superman
description: Supermanis a superhero, and ally ofBatman. Unlike Batman, Superman has a vast amount of superpowers at his disposal naturally occurring in the presence of a yellow star.

name: Wonder_Woman
description: Wonder Womanis an amazonian princess with abilities bestowed to her by the Gods. She is a member of theJustice Leagueand occasionally flirts withBatman.

name: Zatanna
description: Zatannais a "homo magi" that wears the traditional costume of a female magician's assistant. She sometimes fights crime withBatman.

name: Amadeus_Arkham
description: Amadeus Arkhamwas a prominent member of theArkham familyand the founder ofArkham Asylum. Having created the hospital after the murder of his family, he initially wanted to genuinely cure its inmates and treat their mental health. However, owing to a number of factors, Amadeus gradually lost his sanity and was eventually imprisoned within his own creation. Though long dead byBatman's time, Amadeus has affected the superhero's operations indirectly through either his family or asylum, which was us...

name: Quincy_Sharp
description: Quincy Sharpwas the Warden onArkham Islandand Mayor ofGotham Cityduring theArkham Cityera. Though he was seemingly a trustworthy authority figure, he was a covert serial killer and a puppet to ProfessorHugo Strange, with both men sharing a connection to a powerful criminal organization using them for their own operations.

name: Warren_White
description: Formerly crooked investor Warren "The Great White Shark" White, avoided prison time by pleading insanity and was sentenced to Arkham Asylum. There, among other indignities and tortures, White later attempted to get transferred to a minimum security prison. However, Dr. Anne Carver was revealed to have been killed and replaced byJane Doesome months earlier. Her boss, Dr.Jeremiah Arkhamorders that all the paperwork concerning White's transfer be destroyed in revenge for White robbing Arkham of his...

name: Humpty_Dumpty
description: Humphry Dumpler, a large, portly, well-mannered man, is obsessed with putting broken things back together again, even if he has to take them apart. Obese and bald, Dumpler was nicknamed "Humpty-Dumpty" for his egglike form. His crimes at first were minor break-ins, leading to small mechanical items no longer functioning properly due to Dumpty's inability to adequately reassemble them after taking them apart. But soon his obsession grew to the point that major disasters occurred in Gotham and Dum...

name: Fish_Mooney
description: Fish Mooneyis a former nightclub owner and mobster who led a gang under Don Falcone and was the former boss of Oswald Cobblepot.

name: Martha_Wayne
description: Born Martha Kane, Martha was the heir to the Kane Chemical fortune and a member of one ofGotham City's wealthiest families. It has not been revealed whether she has any connection to the other prominent Kanes of Gotham, Kathy or Bette. In her youth, Martha had a reputation as a notorious party girl, socialite, and debutante, frequenting all the most prestigious country clubs, night clubs, and soirees. However, she also had a developed social conscience and often used her family's wealth and stat...

name: Thomas_Wayne
description: Dr. Thomas Waynewas the father ofBruce Wayneand husband ofMartha Wayne. He was a well-known surgeon, philanthropist and CEO ofWayne Enterprises(which he inherited from his own father, after his father made patients on industrial technology, which he invested in real estate making the family billions). In some versions of the mythology he studied to become a surgeon with Dr.Leslie Thompkins, who would open up her own clinic inPark Row, andMatthew Thorne, a.k.a. The Crime Doctor. Thomas worked at ...

name: Leslie_Thompkins
description: Leslie Thompkinsis a medical doctor and a mentor toBatman. Close friends with his parents, Leslie serves as a godparent, along withAlfred Pennyworth, and close confidante to Bruce Wayne.

name: Outsiders
description: The Outsiders form in the fictional Eastern European country of Markovia. Batman and Black Lightning have traveled there in order to free the captive Lucius Fox from Baron Bedlam, who has killed the country's king, King Viktor. Geo-Force himself is the prince of the country who gains powers from Markovia's top scientist, Dr. Helga Jace, in order to stop Bedlam. Metamorpho is searching for Dr. Jace in order for the doctor to help him with his powers. Katana arrives in Markovia in order to kill Ge...

name: Teen_Titans
description: TheTeen Titansare a group of teenage superhero vigilantes who are counterparts to theJustice League. They consist of teenage super heroes and younger versions who fight the crime with the villains.

name: Titans
description: TheTitansis made up of ex-members of theTeen Titanswho have passed the maximum age limit, a kind of purgtory of young heroes not yet permitted join the ranks of theJustice League.

name: Suicide_Squad
description: Task Force Xis a group mostly comprised of incarcerated super-villains who are sent on black ops missions, by the government. The missions in question are often amoral with the government using the supervillains as contingencies for blame. The missions have a low chance of survival in return for lowering their incarceration time, earning the group the nickname of, the "Suicide Squad".

name: Secret_Six
description: TheSecret Sixis brought together in Villains United, a group of villains faced off against other super criminals. Now neither hero nor villain, these rogues do whatever is best for their interests.

name: Rogues_Gallery
description: A gathering of the most traditional top tier villains byBrian Stelfreeze.

name: Batman_Beyond
description: Batman Beyond(also known asBatman of the Futurein some regions) is an American animated television series created by The WB Television Network.Beyondis a futuristic continuation of theThe New Batman Adventures, which was cancelled in favor of a more youth orientedBatman.

name: Terry_McGinnis
description: Terry McGinnis is Batman several decades into the future, also known as Batman Beyond. He is the successor of Bruce Wayne and protector ofNeo-Gotham. After his father, Warren McGinnis, was murdered, Terry took up the mantle of Batman from Bruce Wayne. After avenging his father's death, Terry continued to fight crime as Batman in Neo Gotham. The history of this Terry McGinnis follows the same history as that of the DCAU with the addition that this universe had aBatman Incorporated.

name: Talon
description: William Cobbwas the most foremost and formidable of theTalonassassins used by theCourt of OwlswhenBatmanuncovered the secret society. He is also the great-grandfather ofDick Grayson, AKANightwing.

name: Theo_Galavan
description: Theo Galavanwas a member of theOrder of St. Dumasand Mayor of Gotham City. Along with his sisterTabitha, he was one of the last surviving heirs to the Duma family. Seeking revenge on the Wayne family, he and his sister plotted to sacrificeBruce Wayne. After being killed byJames Gordon, Galavan was subsequently resurrected byIndian Hill's experiments, though memory loss resulted in him donning the identityAzrael.

name: Butch_Gilzean
description: Butch Gilzean(bornCyrus Gold) is a criminal inGotham City. He originally worked for theFalcone Crime Familyunder enforcer and nightclub ownerFish Mooney, before later becoming associated withOswald Cobblepot/The Penguin. After being shot and put into a coma byBarbara Kean, Butch is later dumped inSlaughter Swampby the hospital where he is resurrected after being exposed to chemicals originating fromIndian Hill. He is revived as a ghoulish being, and undertakes the identity ofSolomon Grundy.

name: Silver_St._Cloud
description: Silver St. Cloudis a Gotham City socialite who had a romantic connection toBruce Wayne/Batman. She was also once engaged to U.S. senator Evan Gregory. She is aware that Bruce Wayne is Batman.

name: Jerome_Valeska
description: Jerome Valeskais a major antagonist in the television seriesGotham. Jerome has a twin brother namedJeremiah. In their own way, each were the show's equivalent toThe Jokerat different points in time.

name: Jeremiah_Valeska
description: Jeremiah Valeskais a major antagonist in the television series,Gotham. He is the twin brother of the terrorist cult leader,Jerome Valeska, as well as being the arch-nemesis ofBruce Wayne.

name: Pyg
description: Lazlo ValentinorProfessor Pygis a deranged enemy ofBatman, broadly considered to be amongst his darkest and most disturbing. Pyg is a twisted surgeon, obsessed with the myth of Pygmalion and notions of physical perfection. Due to this, he kidnapsGothamcitizens to horrifically transform into his obedient, "Dollotrons". Professor Pyg is also the leader of theCircus of Strange, a syndicate of circus-freak themed meta-human criminals.

name: Frank_Boles
description: Frank Boleswas a corrupt security officer atArkham Islandin the employment of theJoker. Boles was instrumental in assisting the Joker andHarley Quinnwith their orchestrated takeover of the asylum.

name: Zsasz
description: Victor Zsasz(referred to asZsaszorMr. Zsasz) is a prolific serial killer and an enemy ofBatman. Zsasz is a difficult killer to track as he has no modus operandi outside of posing his victims' corpses in lifelike poses, and carving a tally-mark into his flesh for each kill. Zsasz is motivated by believing all life to be meaningless cycles of pain and that he is actually saving his victims from having to live on.

name: Jack_Ryder
description: Jack Ryder is an outspoken television newscaster and reporter for a Gotham City TV station. As Ryder, he is the anchorman of a show in which he deliberately antagonizes his guests in order to raise attention on hot topics, like stem cell research and medical nanotech. During his research on the revolutionary "nanocells" therapy of Doctor Vincent Yatz, he discovered an experimental mixture which enabled the body to regenerate to the point of completely replacing the skin of a badly scarred burn v...

name: Drury_Walker
description: Killer Mothis a supervillain who was primarily remembered as an antagonist ofBatgirlandBatman. Having decided that the lawbreakers ofGotham Cityneeded a costumed protector just as honest citizens had Batman, Killer Moth emulated the Dark Knight in every way, copying his paraphernalia and building on his legend to create his own super villain identity. He eventually came to resemble a dark mirror image of Batman, even adopting the alter ego of a wealthy philanthropist similar to Bruce Wayne. Moth...

name: Lock-Up
description: Lyle Boltonwas a formerArkham Asylumsecurity guard who specialized in incarceration and high tech security systems. After being fired for using brutal methods to keep the Asylum's patients in line, he would take up the vigilante identityLock-Upand target those who had terminated his employment. Lock-Up was voiced byBruce Weitz.

name: Lyle_Bolton
description: Lyle Boltonwas a formerArkham Asylumsecurity guard who specialized in incarceration and high tech security systems. After being fired for using brutal methods to keep the Asylum's patients in line, he would take up the vigilante identityLock-Upand target those who had terminated his employment. Lock-Up was voiced byBruce Weitz.

name: Film_Freak
description: Burt WestonAKAThe Film Freakis a serial-killer enemy of Batman. Obsessed with films, Weston's modus operandi is to recreate famous movie deaths in his killings.

name: Cavalier
description: Mortimer Drakeis a swashbuckling supervillain who calls himself theCavalier. Drake was once a millionaire who turned to crime when his desire to build a private history museum outstripped his ability to pay for the exhibits, so he stole them. Since then, he has lost his millions and his motivation now is theft for profit. As an enemy of ofBatmanhe uses a rapier as his main weapon and whose trademark is excessive (and often false) gallantry.

name: Monk
description: The MonkorThe Mad Monkis avampiresuper-villain ofBatman. He was the second super-villain ever fought by Batman in publication history as well as the main-antagonist of Batman's first ever two-part storyline. Along with this, the Monk's henchwomanDalais the first female Batman villain in publication history.

name: Dr._Death
description: Doctor Death(Dr. Karl Hellfern) is historically the first super-villain encountered byBatman. He has been reinterpreted several times throughout the series.

name: Karl_Hellfern
description: Doctor Death(Dr. Karl Hellfern) is historically the first super-villain encountered byBatman. He has been reinterpreted several times throughout the series.

name: Alexander_Knox
description: When Knox and Vicki Vale were atWayne Manor(where Bruce Wayne hosted a charity ball to raise $250,000 for Gotham’s 200th Anniversary), Bruce and Vicki hit it off with a great conversation. Knox appeared jealous, but was also a little intrigued by seeing how they got together. Bruce told Knox that he had read his work and liked it “a lot.”

name: Summer_Gleeson
description: Summer Gleesonwas a news reporter and anchor in Gotham City. Summer hoped of one day getting the story on the identity of Batman.

name: Chase_Meridian
description: Dr.Chase Meridianwas a psychologist who moved toGotham Cityas a consultant to thepolice. Chase eventually became romantically involved withBruce Wayne/Batman.

name: Max_Shreck
description: Maximillian "Max" Shreckwas a ruthless business mogul who served as the boss ofSelina Kyleand an ally to thePenguin.

name: Chip_Shreck
description: Charles Shreck, better known as "Chip" (as in both short for Charles, but also "chip off the old block"), was born into immense wealth and privilege, thanks to his father, multi-millionaire industrialist, Max Shreck. In fact, Max's plan to develop an apparent power-plant with the underlying intention of stockpilingGotham City's power was undertaken with the purpose of endowing Chip with a legacy. However, it was also apparent that Chip'smotherwas dead by the point.

name: Jack_Napier
description: Joker becameBatman's first great enemy after he attempted to take control of the city from the mob and committed mass random murders. Unknown to both parties until their later confrontations, Joker and Batman shared a secret past that made them greater enemies. Batman was regarded as an urban legend but his attempts to thwart Napier gradually left him more exposed to the public and made him to be a more local figure.

name: Bob_the_Goon
description: During Jack Napier's career in the mob, his most loyal enforcer and friend was Bob, who defended and protected Jack wherever he went, according to Jack. Bob was always busy trying to accommodate Napier, even in little things such as straightening the mirror or polishing the door handle on Jack's Car.

name: Lawrence
description: Fortunately for Lawrence, he was able to survive and land in the floorboards of the next floor underneath. Shortly after the Joker's demise, Lawrence was taken into medical custody and put into traction due to the injuries he incurred. For a time he was placed in prison. However, due to the manipulations of a mysterious third party, Lawrence was scheduled for a transfer for medical evaluation. An unlocked door and keys left inside a pickup truck allowed Lawrence to escape imprisonment.

name: Magpie
description: Magpiewas an enemy of Batman with an obsession for shiny objects.

name: Margaret_Pye
description: Magpiewas an enemy of Batman with an obsession for shiny objects.

name: Bookworm
description: The Bookwormwas a villain created for the1960s Batman television series. The character was identifiable by his thick glasses and dark brown leather suit, made to match rare old book bindings. He had an affinity for books and centered many of his schemes around them.The characterwas first referenced as part of the mainstream Batman comic books in 1989'sSecret Origins Special#1 and appeared, in a form dramatically different from his television counterpart, as an enemy of the Huntress inThe Huntres...

name: Roddy_McDowall
description: He is a actor for play the role of Cornelius inPlanet of the ApesandEscape from the Planet of the Apes.He have play Ceasar inConquest of the Planet of the ApesandBattle for the Planet of the Apes.He play also Galen in TV SHOWPlanet of the Apes.

name: King_Tut
description: King Tutwas a villain and enemy ofBatmancreated specifically for theBatman1960s TV Series. He was portrayed byVictor Buono.

name: Victor_Buono
description: His character proved among the most popular original villains of the series, and Buono relishied the opportunity to playfully overact on the series.

name: Egghead
description: Eggheadwas a villain created for the1960s Batman television series. He was portrayed byVincent Price. The character was identifiable by his pale bald head and white and yellow suit. He believed himself to be "the world's smartest criminal," and his crimes would usually have an egg-motif to them as well as including egg puns in his speech where appropriate such as "egg-zactly" and "egg-cellent." Additionally, he would use a wide assortment of egg-shaped weapons, such as laughing gas eggs and tear...

name: Louie_the_Lilac
description: Louie the Lilacis a villain and enemy ofBatmancreated specifically for theBatman1960s TV Series.

name: Ma_Parker
description: Ma Parkerwas a villainess and enemy ofBatmanin theBatman 1960s TV Series. She was portrayed byShelley Winters.

name: Shelley_Winters
description: The lateShelley Winterswas an american actress who portrayedMa Parkerin theBatman1960s series.

name: Shame
description: Shamewas a villain and enemy ofBatmanin theBatman1960s TV Series. He was portrayed byCliff Robertson.

name: Cliff_Robertson
description: Cliff Robertsonwas an actor and aviator who portrayedShamein theBatmantelevision series.

name: False_Face
description: False Facewas a criminal make-up artist and master of disguise who uses his skill to impersonate wealthy people.

name: Phantasm
description: The Phantasmis a murderous vigilante and former love-interest ofBatman. Once the romantic partner of Bruce Wayne,Andrea Beaumontbecame a murderous vigilante after her father's death at the hands of criminals. Under this alias, she became an enemy of both Batman andCatwoman.

name: Lloyd_Ventrix
description: Lloyd Ventrix(also known asMojo) was an ex-con that used a suit that rendered him invisible. Using it to commit crimes, he became an enemy ofBatman. Ventrix appears in theBatman: The Animated Seriesepisode "See No Evil".

name: Red_Claw
description: Red Clawis the leader of an international terrorist organization of the same name. She is a stout, opposing figure and master of martial arts, able to match Batman in hand-to-hand combat.

name: Tygrus
description: Tygruswas a hybridized cat-man created by Dr.Emile Dorian.

name: Emile_Dorian
description: Dr. Emile Dorianis a character fromBatman: The Animated Seriesvoiced byJoseph Maher. He is a geneticist who experiments with combining the DNA of humans and animals, most notably felines.

name: Matches_Malone
description: Matches Malone was a small time criminal who was actually a decent human being. One didn't have to be trained in the art of observation to pick him out in a crowd. The tinted glasses, the carefully groomed hair and mustache, the striped shirt and plaid suit.Dick Graysonwould later describe his voice, in Nightwing # 14, as "a perfect North Jersey accent. Flat and nasal." Most significantly, there was the ubiquitous stick match clutched between his thumb and forefinger, ready to be flicked into li...

name: Harper_Row
description: Harper Rowgrew up in the Narrows ofGotham Citywith her younger brother,Cullen. They both had a rough life due to abuse, abandonment and the lack of money. She later became the vigilanteBluebird.

name: Cullen_Row
description: Cullen Rowis a teenage resident of theGotham CityNarrows, and younger brother toHarper Row.

name: Signal
description: Duke Thomasis a vigilante and a member of theBat-Family. He joined the We Are Robin movement and became one of hundred of civilian teenagers to don the Robin R and fight for their city. Eventually, he would leave the movement and join the Batman Family as the vigilante calledThe Signal.
